title: SOUTH For The WINTER
body_text:
EVENT BACKGROUND
Texts confirming the official date and time of FINAL DESTINATION were trasmitted approximately 2 weeks in advance. The poster was completed around the same time and was released with Facebook invitations. It was the first Friday event produced within the Tronolone Era in
over 3 years
.
The name "Final Destination" was chosen in early autumn with tagline
The 2011 Finale Event!
MAIN MATCH
In an
EastCoastDodgeball
rarity, two new comers occupied the captains positions:
Kevin O'Connell versus Kylie Casteling
.
The see-saw match-up included a plethora of 2011 stars such as Kenny Jacobs, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Michael Edwards, and Kris Lribizzi, rejoined by several high-profile names of the past like Rob Avakian, Ryan Letsche, Eamon Fitzpatrick, and Tom Adams.
The nail-biting conclusion witnessed Casteling defeat O'Connell by a close 4 to 3 margin. Casteling captured games 2, 4, 5, and 7; O'Connell took 1, 3, and 6. Prison Ball was instituted in rounds 6 and 7.
ADDITIONAL NOTES
The
attendance of 26
tied for the highest turnout of 2011 along with the year's opener
WINTERBALL
in February. The 21 male participants was the largest number since
ECD
's
5 YEAR ANNIVERSARY
extravaganza in September 2010.
The
four new players
were Angela Ferrelli (#482), Arthur Casbarro Sr. (#483), Kevin O'Connell (#484), and Kylie Casteling (#485). O'Connell and Casteling were also registered as the 82nd and 83rd captains in
ECD
history.
As per
ECD
tradition, FINAL DESTINATION became the 6th event scheduled and experienced during Thanksgiving weekend, the 5th produced under Tronolone. For a recap of previous years, click the following links:
2005 | The ORP Finale
→
2006 | A New Era
→
2007 | Wall vs. All 4
→
2008 | Megill vs. Adams II
→
2010 | Wall vs. All 11
________________________________________
____________________
ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
★ Excellence Awards 2011 ★
Act of Courage Award
★ John Tronolone(3) .. competed with an injured right shoulder throughout 2011
★ Kevin Megill(6) .. competed with an injured left shoulder throughout 2011
→ With 6 "Excellence Awards" to his name, Megill now holds the record for most all-time.
Appreciation Award
★ Christopher Adams(5) .. purchased brand new painballs
★ Katie Grand .. monetary donations toward drinks and
Family Affair IV
raffle
★ Kevin Fitzpatrick(3) .. allowed use of radio and/or iPod, even if not in attendance
★ Robert Knott .. monetary donation towards
Family Affair IV
raffle and photographer at various events
High Jump Award
★ Kenny Jacobs
→ Third recipient of this award following Derek Carty and John Tronolone.
Most Intense Award
★ Jason Teitelbaum
Perfect Attendance Award
★ Joanice Lima(2)
★ John Tronolone(4)
★ Lauren Stopa(2)
→ Lima and Tronolone were recipients of the 2010 Perfect Attendance Award as well.
Powerhouse Thrower Award
★ Kelly Oberto
→ Second female to win this award; the first was Alison Bertsch in 2006.
Ultimate Appreciation Award
★ Lauren Stopa(3) .. countless contributions on / off the court
→ Only one prior recipient of this award - Kathryn Nogueira - in 2006. Prerequisite to such an honor is the Appreciation Award which Stopa earned in 2010.
body_html:
• EVENT BACKGROUND
    Texts confirming the official date and time of FINAL DESTINATION were trasmitted approximately 2 weeks in advance. The poster was completed around the same time and was released with Facebook invitations. It was the first Friday event produced within the Tronolone Era in over 3 years.

    The name "Final Destination" was chosen in early autumn with tagline The 2011 Finale Event!

  • MAIN MATCH
    In an EastCoastDodgeball rarity, two new comers occupied the captains positions: Kevin O'Connell versus Kylie Casteling.

    The see-saw match-up included a plethora of 2011 stars such as Kenny Jacobs, Kevin Fitzpatrick, Michael Edwards, and Kris Lribizzi, rejoined by several high-profile names of the past like Rob Avakian, Ryan Letsche, Eamon Fitzpatrick, and Tom Adams.

    The nail-biting conclusion witnessed Casteling defeat O'Connell by a close 4 to 3 margin. Casteling captured games 2, 4, 5, and 7; O'Connell took 1, 3, and 6. Prison Ball was instituted in rounds 6 and 7.

  • ADDITIONAL NOTES
    The attendance of 26 tied for the highest turnout of 2011 along with the year's opener WINTERBALL in February. The 21 male participants was the largest number since ECD's 5 YEAR ANNIVERSARY extravaganza in September 2010.

    The four new players were Angela Ferrelli (#482), Arthur Casbarro Sr. (#483), Kevin O'Connell (#484), and Kylie Casteling (#485). O'Connell and Casteling were also registered as the 82nd and 83rd captains in ECD history.

    As per ECD tradition, FINAL DESTINATION became the 6th event scheduled and experienced during Thanksgiving weekend, the 5th produced under Tronolone. For a recap of previous years, click the following links: 2005 | The ORP Finale → 2006 | A New Era → 2007 | Wall vs. All 4 → 2008 | Megill vs. Adams II → 2010 | Wall vs. All 11
    ____________________________________________________________

    ONLINE EXCLUSIVE!
    ★ Excellence Awards 2011 ★

    Act of Courage Award
    ★ John Tronolone(3) .. competed with an injured right shoulder throughout 2011
    ★ Kevin Megill(6) .. competed with an injured left shoulder throughout 2011
    → With 6 "Excellence Awards" to his name, Megill now holds the record for most all-time.

    Appreciation Award
    ★ Christopher Adams(5) .. purchased brand new painballs
    ★ Katie Grand .. monetary donations toward drinks and Family Affair IV raffle
    ★ Kevin Fitzpatrick(3) .. allowed use of radio and/or iPod, even if not in attendance
    ★ Robert Knott .. monetary donation towards Family Affair IV raffle and photographer at various events

    High Jump Award
    ★ Kenny Jacobs
    → Third recipient of this award following Derek Carty and John Tronolone.

    Most Intense Award
    ★ Jason Teitelbaum

    Perfect Attendance Award
    ★ Joanice Lima(2)
    ★ John Tronolone(4)
    ★ Lauren Stopa(2)
    → Lima and Tronolone were recipients of the 2010 Perfect Attendance Award as well.

    Powerhouse Thrower Award
    ★ Kelly Oberto
    → Second female to win this award; the first was Alison Bertsch in 2006.

    Ultimate Appreciation Award
    ★ Lauren Stopa(3) .. countless contributions on / off the court
    → Only one prior recipient of this award - Kathryn Nogueira - in 2006. Prerequisite to such an honor is the Appreciation Award which Stopa earned in 2010.
